column1: For a long time they continued neck and neck
column2: and the excitement rose to fever heat. At this juncture a mouse attempted to cross the racecourse
column3: and was instantly devoured by an owl
column4: who acted as police of the course. At length the two racers re-appeared coming toward the grand stand
column6: the place where the Cassowary stood with the signal-gun or
column8: pistol. The shouts and cries became more agitated and violent; there was no doubt about it
column9: —the Stork was ahead! It was in vain that the gallant little Crane strained every sinew; the Stork came into the stand a good three lengths ahead of his adversary. Bang! went the pistol
column10: and the Stork had won. His adherents crowded around him cheering vociferously
column11: and raising him aloft upon their shoulders above the crowd. Even the Cassowary came forward and shook hands with him.
